intro.text: It’s a simple question: can you predict the price of a bottle of wine based on the animal on the label?
intro.instructions: Go ahead, use the sliders. Here are three wines.

intro.text: Even if you didn’t get it right, your rankings show something important: what you assume expense looks like.

scroll.value: Strange, unseemly frogs? Probably cheap. Certainly not hundreds of dollars.

postScroll.value: But do our assumptions about price and class translate from theory to practice? Are the “classic” animals – your stags, horses and lions – truly priced higher than everything else?
As we’ll see, there are patterns and exceptions. But what became most clear over the course of our study was that the question was not simply about predicting price: it was about predicting value.
